title: Arizona Cardinals Week 15 offensive snap counts, observations vs. Texans
description: A look at how the Cardinals split up their 66 offensive snaps against the Texans.
fullText:
In the Arizona Cardinals' 40-20 loss to the Houston Texans on Sunday, 20 players participated in at least one of the 66 offensive snaps.

Quarterback Jacoby Brissett, center Hjalte Froholdt, right guard Isaiah Adams and right tackle Kelvin Beachum played every snap. Left guard Jon Gaines II missed one snap, while tight end Trey McBride played all but five. Wide receiver Michael Wilson missed 10 and running back Michael Carter played all but 13 after Bam Knight was injured on the first Cardinals offensive snap of the game.

Rookie center/guard Hayden Conner played his first NFL offensive snaps with three.

How was the playing time divided up? Below are individual snap counts for every player who got in the game offensively, grouped by position.

The first number after each name is snaps and the second is the percentage. Players in bold were starters.

Active, did not play: Kedon Slovis

Reserve/injured (eligible for return, but won‚Äôt): Kyler Murray

Brissett had another 40-attempt game, completing 27 for 249 yards, three touchdowns, an interception and a 98.9 passer rating. He was sacked twice and ran three times for six yards.

Michael Carter (53/80),¬†Bam Knight (1/2),¬†Emari Demercado (7/11), Corey Kiner (5/8)

Reserve/injured: Trey Benson, James Conner (eligible to return, but won‚Äôt)

Knight was dropped for a loss of minus-2 yards on the Cardinals first offensive play of the game and was carted off after suffering an ankle injury. There was no further information on the severity of the injury.

Carter had a productive game with 56 yards on 14 attempts, while adding 38 yards on three receptions. Active after missing the previous three games because of an ankle injury, Demarcado played only seven snaps and did little with one yard on one rush and no yards on two receptions because of one 5-yard loss. Kiner had two rushes for 11 yards on his five snaps.

Benson‚Äôs 21-day practice window expired Thursday, so he will remain on injured reserve for the remainder of the season.

Michael Wilson (56/85),¬†Jalen Brooks (47/71), Trent Sherfield Sr. (14/21),¬†Andre Baccellia (10/15)

Inactive: WR Marvin Harrison Jr. (injured), Xavier Weaver (injured)

Reserve/injured: Greg Dortch (eligible to return), Simi Fehoko (eligible to return), Zay Jones (eligible to return, but won‚Äôt)

Wilson had a quiet first half with one reception for six yards on four targets. However, he finished with five catches on 11 targets and an 11-yard touchdown. The only other wideout with targets was Brooks, who caught one of three for 19 yards.

Baccellia played only 10 offensive snaps after suffering a neck injury returning a kickoff.

Trey McBride (61/92), Elijah Higgins (46/70),¬†Pharaoh Brown (11/17), Josiah Deguara (8/12)

Reserve/injured: Tip Reiman, Travis Vokolek (both eligible to return, but won‚Äôt)

No matter what defenses do to try and stop him, McBride continues to put up numbers. Targeted 13 times, he caught 12 for 134 yards and two touchdowns. It was his 16th consecutive game with at least five receptions, breaking Travis Kelce‚Äôs league record for tight ends.

He also has 105 receptions this season to become the first tight end in NFL history to register two consecutive 100-reception seasons. Kelce has hit the 100-catch barrier three times in his career, but never in consecutive seasons. The Cardinals overall record for receptions in one season in the 115 by DeAndre Hopkins in 2020. McBride also has 1,071 yards this season after having 1,146 last season. McBride needs 135 yards to pass Jackie Smith (1,205 in 1967) for the Cardinals record for most yards by a tight end in a season.

When asked about the consecutive streak, McBride said, "Sixteen games, for what? We've got to get more wins."

Higgins had one catch for three yards Sunday and Brown had two for one yard.

C Hjalte Froholdt (66/100), RG Isaiah Adams (66/100),¬†RT Kelvin Beachum (66/100),¬†LG Jon Gaines II (65/98), LT Josh Fryar (38/58),¬†LT Demontrey Jacobs (37/56), G Hayden Conner (3/5)

Inactive: G Evan Brown (personal), LT Paris Johnson Jr. (injured)

Active/did not play: T Christian Jones

Reserve/injured: RG Will Hernandez (eligible to return),¬†RT Jonah Williams (eligible to return, but won‚Äôt)

Brown was inactive handling a family matter for the second consecutive game. Head coach Jonathan Gannon said coaches wanted to see Fryar and Jacobs play and they shared snaps at left tackle while also being an extra blocker on run situations.

Get more Cardinals and NFL coverage from Cards Wire's Jess Root and others by listening to the latest on the Rise Up, See Red podcast. Subscribe on Spotify,¬†YouTube¬†or¬†Apple podcasts.

This article originally appeared on Cards Wire: Cardinals Week 15 offensive snap counts, observations vs. Texans

title: Stephanie Vaquer Wins WWE Raw Women's Title Defense By DQ After Nikki Bella Ambush
description: Stephanie Vaquer is still Women's World Champion, but thanks to Nikki Bella ambushing her during her title defense against Raquel Rodriguez, causing the DQ.
fullText:
Stephanie Vaquer is still Women's World Champion, but she won her "WWE Raw" match against Judgment Day's Raquel Rodriguez by interference when WWE Hall of Famer Nikki Bella came through the crowd and caused a disqualification. Rodriguez had established herself as number one contender to Vaquer's title last week, when she took out Bella as she was attempting to demand her rematch after her loss to Vaquer at Survivor Series.

Rodriguez tried to overpower Vaquer to start off their match, and she got a lot of offense in throughout the bout. Vaquer went to the top rope to hit a flying cross body, but her challenger caught her and slammed her to the canvas. The champion tried to get Rodriguez in an armbar around the ropes, but before the referee could even begin a five count, Rodriguez had Vaquer up and hit a power bomb.

Vaquer hit the Devil's Kiss in the middle of the ring, causing Rodriguez to retreat to the corner where Vaquer hit her with a meteora. She tried to get Rodriguez up for the SVB, but couldn't. On the outside of the ring, Rodriguez caught a second Vaquer cross body and looked to throw her into the ring post, but Vaquer countered and sent Rodriguez face-first into the post.

It was then that Bella came out of the crowd to attack Vaquer. She connected with the Rack Attack 2.0 in the ring and later in a backstage segment, Bella said she demanded respect as a legend in the business from the other women.

title: Eight Ohio State football players named AP All-Americans
description: The Associated Press college football All-American Teams were announced on Monday and eight Ohio State players were named.
fullText:
Now that the 2025 college football regular season is over, we are going to continue to hear about postseason awards and various All-American teams. One of the biggest of those is the Associated Press All-American team, and we saw that announced on Monday, with a lot of Ohio State players involved.

In total, eight Buckeyes were named across the three teams, with four of those keeping their hope alive in becoming consensus first-team All-Americans. Safety Caleb Downs, defensive tackle Kayden McDonald, linebacker Arvell Reese, and wide receiver Jeremiah Smith were all named to the first team, with all four already being named to the Walter Camp First-Team as well.

But that wasn't all, because four more Ohio State players appeared on other teams, with linebacker Sonny Styles and wide receiver Carnell Tate being named second-team All-Americans by the Associated Press, while defensive end Caden Curry and quarterback Julian Sayin appeared on the third team.

Smith, widely known as the best receiver in the game, was¬†snubbed for the Biletnikoff Award¬†on Friday. He's caught 80 passes for 1,086 yards and 11 touchdowns. You can bet that he'll make more All-American lists going forward. Smith has had back-to-back 1,000-yard receiving seasons and still has his junior year to go.McDonald has flashed on the scene this year in the middle of the defensive line and is a potential first-round NFL draft pick come April. He clogs up the middle and has tallied 57 tackles with eight tackles for loss and three sacks.

Reese has also come out of nowhere to be considered one of the best linebackers in the country and also a potential first-round NFL draft pick. He has been used all over the field because of his ability to run and react to plays at several levels. He's had 62 tackles with ten tackles for loss and 6.5 sacks.Need a news break?¬†Downs has already¬†taken home¬†the¬†Jim Thorpe Award¬†and is considered by many as the best defensive player in the game, though he did not win the Bednarik Award. Like Reese, he is one of the linchpins of the defense, often lining up at all three levels. He has registered 60 total tackles with five tackles for loss, two interceptions, and a sack so far this year.

The announcement of All-American teams will continue on Tuesday when the AFCA team will be announced. If any of the four first-teamers appear, they will officially garner consensus All-American honors. I like their chances, and even if any of the four don't appear Tuesday, there's still the Sporting News All-American Team on Wednesday, and the Football Writers' Association of America on Thursday.

title: Sam Reinhart scores twice to lead Panthers over Lightning 5-2
description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) ‚Äî Sam Reinhart scored a shorthanded goal and a power play goal to lead the Florida Panthers to a 5-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Monday night.Reinhart recorded his fourth career game with a shorthanded and power play goal in the same game, most in franchise history. Anton Lundell, Brad Marchand and Carter Verhaeghe also scored for Florida, which improved to 5-1-1 in the past seven games.Sergei Bobrovsky finished with 26 saves.
fullText:
TAMPA, Fla. (AP) ‚Äî Sam Reinhart scored a shorthanded goal and a power play goal to lead the Florida Panthers to a 5-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Monday night.

Reinhart recorded his fourth career game with a shorthanded and power play goal in the same game, most in franchise history. Anton Lundell, Brad Marchand and Carter Verhaeghe also scored for Florida, which improved to 5-1-1 in the past seven games.

Sergei Bobrovsky finished with 26 saves.

J.J. Moser and Max Crozier scored for Tampa Bay. Brayden Point finished with a pair of assists. Jonas Johansson, making his seventh consecutive start in place of Andrei Vasilevskiy, made 19 saves.

Reinhart scored shorthanded 2:16 into the first period for Florida‚Äôs fourth shorthanded goal of the season. Reinhart passed Scott Mellanby on the play for sixth most points in franchise history.

The Panthers made it 2-0 at 3:48 moments after Yanni Gourde hit the crossbar on an open chance above the crease before Lundell finished off a 3-on-1 rush.

Marchand made it 3-0 at 11:48 of the second period before Reinhart notched a power play goal with 1:52 remaining.

Crozier scored his first career goal with 33 seconds left in the second. Moser cut it to 4-2 deficit 2:11 into the third period. But Verhaeghe scored his eighth goal in his past 10 games at 6:37 to regain a three-goal lead.

The Panthers played most of the third period without defenseman Gustav Forsling, who blocked a shot from Nikita Kucherov off his arm at 3:03 of the third. Forsling went down the tunnel to the locker room and did not return.

Lightning leading goal scorer Brandon Hagel did not play the final 15-plus minutes of the third period after a hit by Florida defenseman Seth Jones.

Panthers: Host Los Angeles Kings on Wednesday.

Lightning: Host Los Angeles Kings on Thursday.

title: Mark Pope confident the Kentucky offense will blossom as season progresses
description: Kentucky‚Äôs head coach believes shooting success is coming as the Wildcats adjust and find continuity.
fullText:
Mark Pope isn‚Äôt panicking about Kentucky basketball‚Äôs offense, even if the results haven‚Äôt fully shown up yet. Instead, Pope remains confident that patience and adjustments will pay off as the season moves along.

Pope acknowledged this week that Kentucky has tweaked its style of play to better suit its current personnel, focusing on creating space where players feel most comfortable. While the offense has at times looked ‚Äúmocked up‚Äù and physical, Pope views that as part of the growth process rather than a long-term identity.

‚ÄúI actually think our team really, listen, by the end of the year, I think we will be really dangerous shooting the ball,‚Äù Pope said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been on a team where the NOAH numbers don‚Äôt actually eventually transport their way into games. I just have never seen that. So with that history, our expectation is this team will be really dangerous.‚Äù

Kentucky‚Äôs shooting metrics in practice suggest better days ahead, even if the game results haven‚Äôt matched yet, although we have seen some great performances against cupcake teams. Pope emphasized that the biggest hurdle right now is continuity, learning how hard the Wildcats must play to win, and building confidence through small successes.

As that confidence grows, Pope believes the game will begin to open up offensively. At the same time, he likes that his team is learning how to survive and compete in rugged, defensive-minded games, something he believes will matter most in March.

‚ÄúIf we do this right,‚Äù Pope said, ‚Äúit‚Äôs going to bode well for us when we get to the latter part of the season and the post-season.‚Äù

For Pope, the vision is clear: a Kentucky team capable of winning ugly and exploding offensively when it matters most.

title: Patrick Mahomes undergoes surgery to repair ACL day after injury
description: Kansas City Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes underwent successful surgery on his left ACL in Dallas, Texas on Dec. 15.
fullText:
Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes underwent surgery to repair his torn left ACL on Dec. 15 in Dallas, Texas, the team said.

Dr. Dan Cooper, an orthopedic surgeon based in Dallas, performed the surgery. Cooper specializes in knee and shoulder injuries for the Carrell Clinic, based in Texas.

Chiefs head coach Andy Reid said earlier Dec. 15 that Mahomes was seeking a second opinion in the Dallas area. The Chiefs said Mahomes will begin his rehab immediately. The three-time Super Bowl winner will have roughly nine months to prepare for Week 1 of the 2026 season.

Mahomes suffered the injury on Dec. 14 as the Chiefs lost to the Los Angeles Chargers at home, which knocked them out of playoff contention. The two-time MVP was tackled from behind by Chargers defensive end¬†Da'Shawn Hand. Mahomes immediately reached for his left knee after being rolled up from behind as Kansas City's medical staff immediately tended to him.

Injury Update on QB Patrick Mahomes:

Patrick Mahomes successfully underwent surgery in Dallas this evening with Dr. Dan Cooper to repair the tear in his left ACL. Mahomes will begin his rehab process immediately.

‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs (@Chiefs) December 16, 2025

He eventually walked off under his own power but Chiefs head coach Andy Reid told reporters that the initial prognosis did not "look good."

Gardner Minshew replaced Mahomes and purports to be Kansas City's starter for the final three games of the season.

title: Marquez Valdes-Scantling joins Aaron Rodgers in combo Steelers, Packers NFL history
description: MVS is back with his old friend.
fullText:
A little bit of a Green Bay Packers reunion took place on Monday Night Football.

Aaron Rodgers found Marquez Valdes-Scantling for a touchdown against the Miami Dolphins.

RODGERS ‚û°Ô∏è VALDES-SCANTLING TO WIDEN PITTSBURGH'S LEAD TO START THE THIRD üî•

(via @NFL)pic.twitter.com/BQgnDjxZMX

‚Äî Yahoo Sports (@YahooSports) December 16, 2025

Rodgers and MVS had been teammates with the Packers. The Steelers signed Valdes-Scantling to the active roster before Monday's game, and Rodgers put him to quick use.

In the process, Valdes-Scantling made a wild bit of NFL history.

"Marquez Valdes-Scantling is the second player to catch a pass from Aaron Rodgers on both the Packers and Steelers."

MORE: ACL recovery timeline impacts when Patrick Mahomes, Micah Parsons will return

That's right. He caught three of his own passes (off deflections) in Green Bay, and he has one reception of his own pass this season in Pittsburgh.

MVS is a bit more of a receiving threat than Rodgers, of course. He's always been known for his deep speed.

Since leaving Green Bay, Valdes-Scantling has entered into a bit of a journeyman role. But now, he got the chance to come back and join Rodgers.

Rodgers has a history of preferring "his guys" as his wide receivers, and MVS certainly counts as one of them.

On Monday, Rodgers rewarded Valdes-Scantling for coming to town and got him in the end zone.

title: Ohio State football makes the cut for four-star linebacker
description: Quinton Cypher has narrowed his list to four schools, and Ohio State has made the shortlist.
fullText:
As the Ohio State football team prepares for either Texas A&M or Miami in the Cotton Bowl Classic, the recruiting train keeps rolling. Currently, the Buckeyes have seven committed players in the 2027 class, but that number could jump to eight very soon. Four-star linebacker Quinton Cypher is down to four schools, and OSU has made the cut.

Cypher hails from Raleigh, North Carolina, and is rated as the No. 11 linebacker in the class according to 247Sports composite rankings. Watching this young man on film, he is explosive, quick to the ball, and can catch players from behind. Recently, Cypher narrowed his choices down to four schools, which include Ohio State, Alabama, Georgia, and Miami.

However, it seems that OSU may have the inside track. According to insiders, the Buckeyes and Bulldogs are in a battle for this one, but On3's Steve Wiltfong logged a crystal ball prediction for Cypher to choose the Scarlet and Gray shortly after the list was trimmed to four.

title: Lincoln Riley confirms who will ‚Äî and won't ‚Äî be playing for USC in Alamo Bowl
description: Kamari Ramsey, Makai Lemon, Ja'Kobi Lane, Lake McRee and Eric Gentry are among the players who will not be playing for USC against TCU in the Alamo Bowl.
fullText:
Following Monday afternoon‚Äôs practice at Howard Jones Field, USC coach Lincoln Riley addressed the media for the first time since the Trojans‚Äô victory over crosstown rival UCLA on Nov. 29.

USC (9-3), ranked No. 16 in the AP poll, is preparing to play Texas Christian (9-4) on Dec. 30 in the Alamo Bowl in San Antonio.¬†USC finished 7-2 in its second season in the Big Ten and won four of its last five¬†games, the only setback during that stretch being a 42-27 loss to Oregon, which is the No. 5 seed in the College Football Playoff.

Riley announced that safety Kamari Ramsey, receivers Makai Lemon and Ja‚ÄôKobi Lane, tight end Lake McRee and linebacker Eric Gentry will not play in the Alamo Bowl. Lane declared for the NFL draft on Monday.

‚ÄúAnthony Lucas and Bishop Fitzgerald want to play in the game but are dealing with injuries and trying to get back ... we‚Äôll see how that goes,‚Äù Riley said. ‚ÄúKilian O‚ÄôConnor and Elijah Paige and Jahkeem Stewart all had surgery and will be ready to roll.‚Äù

Asked about signing the No. 1 recruiting class for 2026, Riley said: ‚ÄúIt was a great day. We tried to keep the focus on building next year‚Äôs team. The amount of guys that we signed is a big portion of it and as we start to look ahead ... half of our day and maybe even more is pointing towards next year and coming years. Meanwhile, obviously getting ready for this bowl game. It was a lot of hard work to add talent and people who care about this place and starting to put next year‚Äôs team together has been exciting here these last few weeks.‚Äù

Riley has a 35-27 record in his four seasons at USC and is hoping to improve his bowl record to 3-1. He guided the Trojans to wins in the 2023 Holiday Bowl and 2024 Las Vegas Bowl.

Riley watched the CIF state Open Division bowl game between Santa Margarita (coached by former Trojans quarterback and Heisman Trophy winner Carson Palmer) and De La Salle on Saturday and was impressed by the performance of USC commit Trent Mosley, who had 11 catches for 183 yards and two touchdowns and a rushing touchdown in the Eagles‚Äô 47-13 win.

‚ÄúHe was someone we targeted very early on,‚Äù Riley said. ‚ÄúI thought he was super impressive and it was important. He‚Äôs one of the best receivers in the country. He‚Äôs proven that and he just played out of his mind. It‚Äôs a great family and he‚Äôs a really smart kid.‚Äù

Asked what advice he gives to players who are deciding what to do next in their careers, Riley said: ‚ÄúYes, it‚Äôs an important decision. The guys that make the right decision no matter what it is get a leg up on the rest of their lives. Consequently, a wrong decision can be catastrophic. That‚Äôs the world we all live in. I just try to educate them on their options. I don‚Äôt like telling guys you should do this or you shouldn‚Äôt do that. It‚Äôs more about, here‚Äôs this option, this is what it would look like, here‚Äôs what you need to consider. Sometimes the decision‚Äôs pretty clear one way or another, other times it‚Äôs not. I try to give them as much guidance as I possibly can.‚Äù

Given that USC will be missing quite a few players who were key contributors throughout the season, Riley is not ruling out the possibility of younger players seeing action against TCU.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs gonna be guys all over the place who are going to have opportunities,‚Äù Riley said. ‚ÄúAll sides of the ball, all position groups, maybe it‚Äôs some of the guys you saw a little bit during the season and in some instances you‚Äôll see guys get some burn in this game that haven‚Äôt played at all or very little. Bowl games are great, but days like this are the most valuable part of it because we‚Äôre just pouring reps into all of these guys, it‚Äôs super competitive and the energy level is just different. All these guys feel it‚Äôs their time.‚Äù

Riley admitted he and his staff had to make hard decisions based on the incoming freshmen, a majority of whom are spring enrollees.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs huge, it‚Äôs a high, high number that are going to be here and it‚Äôs important,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had to make a bunch of roster decisions in the last couple of weeks. We have a large number of players who have already signed and some of the decisions we had to make were based on knowing what we have coming in, and when you sign as many as we did, you‚Äôre going to have tough decisions to make.‚Äù

title: DK Metcalf gives Steelers a 21-3 lead
description: The Steelers punted on their first three drives.
fullText:
The Steelers punted on their first three drives. They have scored touchdowns on their last three drives.

The Steelers lead the Dolphins 21-3.

DK Metcalf caught a 28-yard touchdown pass with 4:58 remaining in the third quarter to increase the Steelers' lead. Dolphins safety Ashtyn Davis nearly got a hand on the ball as he dove in front of it.

The touchdown came on third-and-12.

The Steelers began the night 0-for-6 on third down but have converted their past four.

Rodgers is 19-of-22 for 180 yards and two touchdowns, with Metcalf catching three for 55 and a score.

title: High school student shows perseverance through cross country injury
description: UNION GROVE, Texas (KETK) ‚Äî Union Grove student athlete, Landry Harris, showed her perseverance and dedication to her sport by pushing through a potentially season-ending injury. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve kind of done sports my whole life,‚Äù Harris said. ‚ÄúMy family‚Äôs very, very into sports. All my brothers did sports. So I‚Äôve been doing them since third grade.
fullText:
UNION GROVE, Texas (KETK) ‚Äî Union Grove student athlete, Landry Harris, showed her perseverance and dedication to her sport by pushing through a potentially season-ending injury.

Union Grove ISD names new superintendent

‚ÄúI‚Äôve kind of done sports my whole life,‚Äù Harris said. ‚ÄúMy family‚Äôs very, very into sports. All my brothers did sports. So I‚Äôve been doing them since third grade.‚Äù

She‚Äôs played numerous sports throughout the years, but truly found her stride in cross country, even setting a school record her freshman year. But before her season even started this year, she tore her ACL, an injury that can put athletes on the bench for more than 9 months.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been an emotional journey because running is my big thing,‚Äù Harris said. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt know if I‚Äôd be able to run this season with my team and keep our streaks alive and just be there for my team because that‚Äôs what I love doing.‚Äù

Through her recovery process, she said she found out she might be able to compete this season.

‚ÄúI got told by my doctors that if I put in the work at physical therapy this summer, that I would be able to get back to running before surgery,‚Äù Harris said.

So that‚Äôs what she did, working every week to get better and better to overcome this injury while pushing her team to grow together through a difficult season.

‚ÄúIn a strange way, the injury has grown us¬†all because as a coaching staff, we‚Äôve been able to see our kids rally around one another, and other kids got stronger and maintained that going into the season,‚Äù Girls‚Äô athletic coordinator JB Littlejohn said.

During this recovery, Harris became an inspiration to her teammates and peers.

‚ÄúShe was our athlete of the Year last year as a freshman,‚Äù Littlejohn said. ‚ÄúHer competitive nature, combined with her work ethic, you put that with the natural talent, that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre seeing what she‚Äôs doing.‚Äù

Through determination and hard work, Landry and her team made it all the way to the state cross country meet.

‚ÄúIt was very like congratulating, and I felt like my efforts and everything that I went through paid off finally,‚Äù Harris said.

title: Brandon Ingram scores 28 points and Raptors end 4-game skid with 106-96 win over Heat
description: Brandon Ingram scored 28 points and the Toronto Raptors snapped a four-game skid with a 106-96 victory Monday night over Miami, extending the Heat‚Äôs losing streak to five.  Miami lost forward Nikola Jovic to an elbow injury in the first quarter.  Scottie Barnes added 17 points and 10 rebounds and Immanuel Quickley finished with 15 points for the Raptors, who made 16 3-pointers.
fullText:
MIAMI (AP) ‚Äî Brandon Ingram scored 28 points and the Toronto Raptors snapped a four-game skid with a 106-96 victory Monday night over Miami, extending the Heat‚Äôs losing streak to five.

Miami lost forward Nikola Jovic to an elbow injury in the first quarter. Jovic took a hard foul from Collin Murray-Boyles while driving to the basket and fell to the floor 12 seconds after he entered the game.

Scottie Barnes added 17 points and 10 rebounds and Immanuel Quickley finished with 15 points for the Raptors, who made 16 3-pointers. Ingram shot 5 of 7 from behind the arc.

Sandro Mamukelashvili scored 11 points and Gradey Dick added 10 for Toronto.

Norman Powell and Bam Adebayo scored 20 points each and Davion Mitchell added 12 points for the Heat, who played without Tyler Herro. He sat out because of a right toe contusion.

It was the first time this season the Heat were held under 100 points.

Down by five early in the fourth quarter, Toronto took the lead for good with a 17-2 run. Jamal Shead‚Äôs 3-pointer with 7:31 remaining put the Raptors ahead 91-81.

The Heat narrowed the deficit to four points when Powell made three free throws with 1:28 left. But Shead hit a floating jumper and Barnes followed with a putback layup.

The Raptors are 4-6 since RJ Barrett, the team‚Äôs third-leading scorer, sprained his right knee against Brooklyn on Nov. 23. Barrett, who averages 19.4 points per game, began on-court workouts Monday, coach Darko Rajakovic said.

Raptors: At Milwaukee on Thursday.

AP NBA: https://apnews.com/hub/nba

title: Mike Tomlin's Steelers are on a worse streak than any head coach ever has had in NFL history
description: It's hard to believe this stat.
fullText:
Mike Tomlin's Steelers are on a worse streak than any head coach ever has had in NFL history originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Things got better for the Pittsburgh Steelers on Monday night.

But the first quarter of their primetime clash with the Miami Dolphins started the same way games have been starting for years for Mike Tomlin's squad.

On this particular night, the Steelers didn't score in the first quarter.

It extended a streak of games that Pittsburgh hasn't scored more than seven points in a first quarter to an astonishing mark.

MORE:¬†ACL recovery timeline impacts when Patrick Mahomes, Micah Parsons will return

It's been 64 such games in a row.

The 1st quarter ends with the Dolphins and Steelers scoreless.

The Steelers extend their streak of scoring 7 or fewer 1st quarter points to 64 straight games, all under Mike Tomlin.

That is the longest active streak in the NFL and longest streak by a Head Coach in NFL history.‚Ä¶

‚Äî ESPN Insights (@ESPNInsights) December 16, 2025

MORE:¬†Bills may not win the AFC East ‚Äî but they sent a clear warning to the rest of the NFL

Sure, the Steelers of recent vintage are often a little more deliberate, putting together slower and longer drives. And they haven't been the most explosive offense ever.

But 64 games in a row of 7 or less in the first quarter? That seems pretty much impossible.

Tomlin's crew has done it, though. What a wild streak.

title: Celtics fall in home slug fest to Pistons, 112-105
description: The Celtics had a chance to record their second win of the season against the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons. But they made too many mistakes.
fullText:
BOSTON ‚Äî On Monday night, the Boston Celtics had a golden opportunity to earn their second win of the season against the Eastern Conference-leading Detroit Pistons. Instead, the C's faltered in the second half and fell victim to preventable mistakes, losing 112-105 and dropping to 15-11 overall.

Boston shot an abysmal 26% from deep and failed to convert on 8 their 27 free throw attempts. Detroit was also sloppy, but its made a habit out of winning these kinds of ugly games.

Celtics guard Derrick White exploded in the fourth quarter, tallying 17 of his 31 points in the final frame. Celtics star Jaylen Brown also had 34 points on the night, but no other Celtic scored over 12 points.

As for the Pistons, star point guard Cade Cunningham dazzled with 32 points and a game-high 10 assists in 36 minutes. His consistent makes kept the Celtics at bay all game long.

Monday marked the Pistons first win at TD Garden since 2022. They remain in first place in the East while the Celtics fall to fourth and have dropped back-to-back games for the first time since November 3rd. The Green Team will get a chance to bounce back on Friday night versus the 14-12 Miami Heat.

title: Orioles face massive Yankees and Red Sox challenge in Michael King pursuit
description: King narrows free agency to Orioles, Yankees and Red Sox.
fullText:
Orioles face massive Yankees and Red Sox challenge in Michael King pursuit originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Baltimore Orioles find themselves facing massive odds to sign free agent pitcher Michael King, as two other American League East teams have joined the race for the former San Diego Padres pitcher. The right-handed ace has reportedly narrowed down the list to these three AL East teams, and as per sources, a decision could come soon.

According to MLB insider Ken Rosenthal, the New York Yankees and the Boston Red Sox are both interested in the proven commodity. The insider has suggested that for the Orioles to get their hands on King, they'll have to outbid both AL East competitors, which will be a massive task, given the big market status.

King actually has local ties with Boston, as he went to¬†Bishop Hendricken High School in Rhode Island and pitched for Boston College. Meanwhile, the Yankees are also associated with the pitcher since they traded for him from the Miami Marlins in November 2017. Earlier, there were rumors that the Chicago Cubs were an interested party, but now it appears his free agency has settled down for an AL East competitor.

The right-hander is a proven commodity in the majors. He was part of the transaction that sent Juan Soto to the New York Yankees before the 2024 season, thereby landing with the Padres, where he became a reliable arm, posting a sub-3.00 ERA in 173.2 innings. Due to shoulder and knee inflammation this year, he could only make 15 starts, recording a 3.44 ERA with a 1.20 WHIP.

The Orioles have already shown signs of improvement this offseason as they added Pete Alonso on a five-year, $155 million deal. Adding a reliable arm like King to their rotation will enhance their rotation, which also includes¬†established pieces such as Trevor Rogers and Kyle Bradish, and will help Baltimore get back to the postseason after missing it in 2025.

It remains to be seen if the Orioles, despite the uphill task to outdo AL East giants, can get King to sign with them.

title: Cunningham leads Pistons past Celtics
description: Cade Cunningham scored 32 points as the Detroit Pistons held off the Boston Celtics 112-105 to extend their lead at the top of the Eastern Conference standings on Monday.Pistons point guard Cunningham produced another potent offensive display in a back-and-forth duel that saw the lead change hands 15 times before Detroit pulled away in the final minutes.
fullText:
Cade Cunningham scored 32 points as the Detroit Pistons held off the Boston Celtics 112-105 to extend their lead at the top of the Eastern Conference standings on Monday.

Pistons point guard Cunningham produced another potent offensive display in a back-and-forth duel that saw the lead change hands 15 times before Detroit pulled away in the final minutes.

Cunningham, averaging just under 27 points this season, rattled in six three-pointers in 11-of-21 shooting from the field to help Detroit improve to 21-5 in the Eastern Conference.

But Detroit were made to work hard for their fourth straight win after a dogged performance from Boston, who led by as many as 12 points in the second quarter before being reeled in.

"We love games like this that are tough, muddy," Cunningham said. "I think the game getting that way turns us up a little bit more."

Detroit's starters were backed by 47 points from the bench, with Caris LeVert coming on to add 13 points in 19 minutes on court and Jaden Ivey finishing with 10 points.

"We're deep -- we got starters up and down the roster," Cunningham said. "Guys who come in and do their job better than anybody in the league. It's fun to play with."

Jaylen Brown led Boston's scoring with 34 points while Derrick White finished with 31.

The Toronto Raptors improved to 16-11 to move into third place in the Eastern Conference with a 106-96 road win over the Miami Heat.

Brandon Ingram's 28 points laid the foundation for Toronto, who outscored Miami 32-19 in the fourth quarter to wrap up the win.

title: Rams vs. Seahawks injury report: Davante Adams, Braden Fiske DNP
description: The Rams and Seahawks are getting ready for Thursday‚Äôs showdown, releasing estimated injury reports to start the week Monday.
fullText:
After knocking off the Detroit Lions on Sunday, the Los Angeles Rams will quickly turn around and prepare for the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday night in a game that could decide the NFC West. Both teams released their initial injury reports on Monday despite not practicing as usual, providing an estimation of each player's participation level.

Predictably, Davante Adams was listed as a non-participant due to his hamstring injury, as was Braden Fiske. Jaylen McCollough, who was added to the injury report on Saturday with an illness, was estimated as a non-participant on Monday.

Jordan Whittington, Alaric Jackson and Nick Vannett were all listed as limited.

Charles Cross was the only player who was estimated as a non-participant for the Seahawks, who only held a walkthrough on Monday. Demarcus Lawrence and Cody White were limited and everyone else would‚Äôve been a full participant.

title: Heat skid hits 5 as Herro misses 106-96 loss to Raptors
description: MIAMI ‚Äì The payoff for five days off? A fifth straight loss. Whether playing games in bunches or otherwise, it is not going well for the Miami Heat, this time falling 106-96 Monday night to the Toronto Raptors at Kaseya Center. Still without a victory since Dec. 1, the Heat this time could not overcome another injury absence from guard Tyler Herro.
fullText:
MIAMI ‚Äì The payoff for five days off? A fifth straight loss.

Whether playing games in bunches or otherwise, it is not going well for the Miami Heat, this time falling 106-96 Monday night to the Toronto Raptors at Kaseya Center.

Still without a victory since Dec. 1, the Heat this time could not overcome another injury absence from guard Tyler Herro.

Factor in an ugly early tumble that left Heat forward Nikola Jovic with an elbow injury and the return from the five-day break seemingly only pushed Erik Spoelstra‚Äôs team further toward a breaking point.

As has been the case in recent games, the offense again sputtered, much of the early-season energy missing.

So while the Raptors snapped their four-game losing streak, the Heat‚Äôs moved to five.

Bam Adebayo led the Heat with 20 points and 10 rebounds, with Norman Powell also scoring 20. Otherwise, not nearly enough amid Herro‚Äôs absence.

Brandon Ingram led the Raptors with 28 points.

Five degrees of Heat from Monday night‚Äôs game:

‚Äî Game flow: The Raptors led 23-22 after the first period, with the Heat then moving to a 52-46 halftime lead. From there, the Heat went into the fourth quarter up 77-74.

The Raptors swiftly moved to a 91-81 lead with 7:31 to play, putting the Heat in catch-up mode from that stage, as the offense stalled.

From there, the Heat closed within 100-96 with 1:28 to play on a pair of Powell free throws, but the inability to get a defensive stop on the other and then the Heat‚Äôs 19th turnover effectively ended it.

‚Äî No Herro: Having returned from a two-game absence in last Tuesday night‚Äôs NBA Cup loss in Orlando, Herro again was listed as out with a toe contusion, his third game missed with the ailment since Dec. 5. That is in addition to the 17 games he missed at the start of the season after September ankle surgery.

With guard Pelle Larsson out due to an ankle sprain, it resulted in the first Heat start for Simone Fontecchio, in an opening lineup rounded out by Adebayo, Powell, Andrew Wiggins and Davin Mitchell.

That gave the Heat their 11th lineup in their 26 games.

‚Äî Jovic lost: Jovic left in the first period with his right arm in a protective brace after a hard fall.

The Heat listed it as an elbow injury, ruling him out for the night.

Jovic, who had been held out of the rotation in two of the previous three games, got the opportunity for the playing time with Herro and Larsson sidelined.

Jovic entered Monday night‚Äôs game with 3:50 to play in the opening period and was forced out 12 seconds later.

Because Jovic was unable to shoot the free throws from the foul on Toronto‚Äôs Collin Murray-Boyles, the Raptors were allowed to select the replacement shooter. They selected seldom-used forward Keshad Johnson, who entered 7 of 11 from the line, making both replacement free throws.

Johnson then remained in the game, taking the minutes that would have gone to Jovic.

A stretcher initially was brought to the court, with Jovic instead able to walk off the court while assisted.

‚Äî Still struggling: For the first time in a week, Fontecchio hit a shot, after going 0 for 5 in last week‚Äôs loss in Orlando.

But the struggles remain ongoing, with Fontecchio closing 1 of 5 from the field Monday night, including 1 of 4 from beyond the arc.

‚Äî Up next: It‚Äôs now out on the road for a three-game trip for the Heat after a two-day break, opening with a back-to-back set on Thursday and Friday nights against the Brooklyn Nets and then the Boston Celtics, with the trip concluding Sunday against the New York Knicks.

The Heat‚Äôs next home game also will be against the Raptors, on Dec. 23.

title: NHRA Countdown to Championship Shifts to Michigan Dragstrip
description: Surprise announcement that IHRA has acquired NHRA mainstay Maple Grove Raceway triggers scramble to replace playoff opener.
fullText:
U.S. 131 Motorsports Park at Martin, Mich., will host its first NHRA national event as the opener to the six-race showdown in the Mission Foods Drag Racing Series.

Maple Grove Raceway, near Reading, Pa., changed hands, effective Friday, from NHRA sanction to rival IHRA affiliation.

Return to Michigan for first time since 1960 U.S. Nationals buoys NHRA‚Äôs 2026 calendar.

Koretsky family says move to IHRA satisfies ‚Äúinnovative, forward-thinking approach [that] this sport has been missing.‚Äù

The upcoming inaugural Great Lakes Nationals Sept. 18-20 at Martin, Michigan‚Äôs US 131 Motorsports Park represents more than a schedule change in the NHRA‚Äôs 2026 Countdown to the Championship.

The abrupt change in the NHRA‚Äôs 2026 calendar came with the rival International Hot Rod Association‚Äôs announcement Friday at the PRI Show at Indianapolis that it has acquired Maple Grove Raceway, marking a significant milestone for the sport of drag racing.

This 15th of 20 races during the NHRA‚Äôs 75th anniversary season‚Äîthe first of six playoff races in the Mission Foods Drag Racing Series‚Äîsignifies a major shift in power in the straightline sport. It exposes significant disagreement about management styles between the NHRA and a resurgent IHRA. Maple Grove Raceway, near Reading, Pennsylvania, has been one of the NHRA‚Äôs strongest pillars for a national spectrum of events.

From the NHRA‚Äôs perspective, it‚Äôs a bit of a coup, too. The Great Lakes Nationals will mark the first major NHRA event in Michigan, the center of the US auto manufacturing industry, since the 1960 US Nationals at Detroit Dragway. And it will showcase one of the most updated and family friendly facilities in the country.

The Martin, Michigan, race has become one of four new racetracks on the NHRA schedule for 2026. Maryland International Raceway, South Georgia Motorsports Park, and Rockingham (North Carolina) Dragway already have joined the 20-race lineup.

So despite the IHRA‚Äôs rekindled rivalry with the NHRA, the latest move only indicates the overall health of the sport.

But Friday‚Äôs news was a blow to the NHRA, which announced this past September that it had a Saturday sellout crowd for the fourth-straight year at its Countdown to the Championship kickoff at Maple Grove Raceway.

Always one of the most popular dragstrips on the national tour, owner Kenny Koretsky and family raised the bar by sinking millions of dollars and tons of energy into customer service at the historic Eastern Pennsylvania venue since they purchased it in 2022.

So the so-called ‚ÄúHouse of Chaos‚Äù‚Äînicknamed for former Pro Stock racer Kenny Koretsky‚Äôs reputation as ‚ÄúCaptain Chaos‚Äù‚Äîplunged the NHRA into a bit of chaos for a few days. Unsuccessful repeated attempts to contact the NHRA since Friday produced a prepared statement Monday about the playoff opener‚Äôs move to Michigan.

While the NHRA has moved on to its fresh affiliation with US 131 Motorsports Park, the IHRA takes over one of the NHRA‚Äôs biggest revenue-streaming facilities.

‚ÄúThis is a track with deep roots and an even stronger future,‚Äù IHRA owner Darryl Cuttell said. ‚ÄúMaple Grove represents what racing should be: competitive, welcoming, and centered [on] racers and families. Bringing it under the IHRA umbrella is not just a business decision‚Äîit‚Äôs a commitment to strengthening the sport and investing in its long-term success.‚Äù

The Koretsky family emphasized the personal significance of this transition.

‚ÄúMaple Grove has always been more than a racetrack to our family‚Äîit is home, not just for us, but for generations of racers,‚Äù the Koretskys said. ‚ÄúOur mission has always been to preserve this facility and ensure it remains a premier racing destination. Seeing Maple Grove join the IHRA family feels like a natural and meaningful next step for the sport.

‚ÄúMeeting Darryl and Leah from the IHRA was truly eye-opening. Their vision, work ethic, and genuine passion for racers and fans are unmatched,‚Äù they said. ‚ÄúTheir innovative, forward-thinking approach is exactly what this sport has been missing. The IHRA shares our values‚Äîmaking racing affordable, fun, and family-centered. This new chapter is about honoring Maple Grove‚Äôs legacy while elevating the experience for future generations.‚Äù

The Koretsky family said it looks forward to working closely with the IHRA throughout 2026 and beyond.

As for the NHRA‚Äôs new focus, President Glen Cromwell said Monday in a statement that the Martin, Michigan, event is ‚Äúa[n] historic milestone for the facility, and it‚Äôs another terrific way to celebrate our 75th anniversary season, bringing the incredible action of NHRA drag racing to the passionate fan base in Michigan.‚Äù He said it ‚Äúwill be extremely meaningful during our 75th anniversary season, as it reflects NHRA‚Äôs continued commitment to growing the sport and bringing championship-level NHRA racing to outstanding venues. The track‚Äôs dedication to its racers and fans, and its enthusiasm as a new NHRA Member Track makes it an excellent addition to the national tour.‚Äù

US 131 Motorsports Park will also host a yet-to-be defined NHRA national open July 8-9, leading into a July 10-12 Lucas Oil Drag Racing Series (sportsman) divisional event.

title: Illinois‚Äô Wagler named Big Ten Freshman of the Week
description: A big honor for the freshman.
fullText:
Keaton Wagler was named Big Ten Freshman of the Week on Monday.

In his first two league games last week, Wagler averaged 21 points and 7.5 assists. He scored a career-high 23 points in the win over Ohio State, and followed that up with a double-double in the three-point loss to Nebraska.

David Mirkovic won the FOTW award the first two weeks of the season, so the Illini have claimed three out of the six awards so far.

Illinois is off this week before meeting Missouri in the Braggin‚Äô Rights game next Monday, Dec. 22.

title: Bavarian Loan Works: A jam-packed update
description: N√ºbel had a disasterous outing against Bayern, Krattenmacher has great appearance off the bench, Guzm√°n wins a double
fullText:
I have said this before, but I always have the best intentions on writing when I go on vacation, but it never happens. Good news for you is that you get two weeks of updates of Bayern loanees all wrapped into one article! We will be looking back at the entire month of December so far. This includes the last round of Pokal (and other cup competitions), a European competition window, and two weekends of league play. Pertetz got back into action and Krattenmacher had a goal and an assist off the bench in the Pokal matches. N√ºbel allowed five goals against Bayern, but then had two great results since. Palhinha has been on a terrible streak without a shot attempt in four matches. Plus, Guzm√°n helped her team secure a league-cup double in the final match of the season.

There are nine players from on loan from the first team.

There are four players on loan to the German Bundesliga: Alexander N√ºbel, Ibrahimoviƒá, Daniel Peretz, and Armindo Sieb.

N√ºbel was on the bench for Stuttgart‚Äôs 2-0 win against Bochum in the DFB-Pokal.

He returned to the starting lineup against his parent club that weekend against at home against Bayern. Things did not go well for him. Although he saved five shots, he also conceded five goals ‚Äî one of which was due to an error he made. He received no help from his offense and fell at home 5-0.

N√ºbel remained in the lineup for Stuttgart‚Äôs home match against Maccabi Tel Aviv in the Europa League. He only saved one attempt on goal in this match, but also conceded a goal. Luckily he did receive scoring support from his team in this match and Suttgart won 4-1.

Stuttgart travelled to face Werder Bremen on Sunday. N√ºbel was in goal again and saved all three shots on goal that he faced and earned the shutout for Stuttgart. His teammates were able to score four road goals to earn a 4-0 win far from home.

Stuttgart will host Hoffenheim on Saturday.

Ibrahimoviƒá was on the bench for the beginning of Heidenheim‚Äôs match against Freiburg. He came into the match at halftime with his team down 1-0. He did not have a shot attempt but created two chances for his teammates to shoot. Although he did not directly contribute to a goal, his teammates were able to score two goals and earn the 2-1 win at home.

Ibrahimoviƒá started for Heidenheim on the road against St Pauli in Hamburg. He had one shot ‚Äî on goal ‚Äî and created three chances for his teammates to shoot. This was not enough for Heidenheim to find more than one goal and they fell on the road 2-1.

Heidenheim will host Bayern on Sunday in the final fixture of the calendar year.

Peretz started for Hamburg against Holstein Kiel in the DFB-Pokal last Wednesday. The match was scoreless after 90 minutes and Peretz kept a shutout through 118 minutes. He had three saves in that time, but the one goal was enough to send the match to penalties. In penalties he only saved one attempt but he allowed four goals. They fell 4-2 in penalties and HSV were eliminated from the tournament.

Peretz was on the bench for the next two matches: a 3-2 home win against Werder Bremen and a 4-1 road loss against Hoffenheim.

Sieb was not in the matchday lineup for Mainz‚Äô 1-0 home loss against Borussia Monchengladbach. He was on the bench for Mainz‚Äô 1-1 draw in Poland against Lech Poznan in the Conference League and a 2-2 road draw against Bayern in league play, but he did not get into either match.

Mainz will host Turkish side Samsunspur on Thursday in the Conference League. They will also host St Pauli on Sunday in the last league match of the year.

There are two player on loan to the English Premier League: Jo√£o Palhinha and Jonah Kusi-Asare.

Palhinha was on bench on 12/3 for Spurs‚Äô 2-2 draw at Newcastle but did not get into the match.

Palhinha was again on the bench last weekend at home against Brentford. He entered the match in the 65th minute up 2-0. He did not have a shot attempt nor did he create a shot for his teammates to shoot either. The score did not change while he was on the pitch as Spurs earned the 2-0 win at home.

Spurs hosted Slavia Prague on Tuesday in the Champions League and Palhinha returned to the starting lineup. He again did not have a shot nor a chance created for his teammates to shoot, but Spurs were able to score three goals through an own goal and two penalties. Palhinha helped Spurs keep a shutout with three clearances, an interception, and five recoveries. Spurs earned a lackluster 3-0 home win.

Spurs were away to Nottinham Forest on Sunday and Palhinha started back on the bench. He came into the match in the 59th minute right after Spurs went down 2-0. He again had zero shot attempts and zero chances created for his teammates to shoot. He helped back on defense again with two clearances and four recoveries, but this was not enough to keep Forest from scoring again. Spurs fell 3-0 on the road.

Tottenham will host Liverpool on Saturday.

Kusi-Asare started on the bench for Fulham as they hosted Manchester City on 12/3. He entered the match in the second half with his team down 5-3. He did not have a shot attempt and created one shot for his teammates to shoot. Fulham were able to score one more, but could not find an equalizer, falling 5-4 at home.

Fulham host cross-town rivals Crystal Palace last weekend. Kusi-Asare was on the bench, but did not make it into the match for their 2-1 loss. He was not in the matchday squad for the 3-2 road win against Burnley.

Fulham will go on the road to face Newcastle in the EFL Cup on Wednesday in their only match this week.

Bryan Zaragoza is the only player on loan to Spain‚Äôs La Liga.

Zaragoza was not in the matchday squad for Celta Vigo‚Äôs Copa del Rey match against second division Sant Andreu. Celta Vigo advanced to the next round after both teams scored in extra time, requiring penalties. They won the penalty shootout 7-6.

Zaragoza returned to the squad and started at Real Madrid last weekend. He did not have a shot attempt but assisted the opening goal in the 53rd minute to put his team up 1-0. Ten minutes later Madrid‚Äôs Garcia received two yellows within two minutes. Zaragoza was subbed off in the 71st minute and watched Madrid do the same thing in stoppage time as Carreras received two quick yellows and went down to nine men. Celta Vigo scored again directly after and secured a 2-0 win on the road.

Celta Vigo returned home to host Italy‚Äôs Bologna in the Europa League. After assisting Swedberg against Madrid, Swedberg returned the favor and assisted Zaragoza‚Äôs opening goal in the 17th minute. That was his only shot attempt and he also had zero chances created for his teammates to shoot. He was subbed off at halftime with his goal still the only one in the match. Unfortunately his goal was not enough for his teammates to see the win out. Two second half goals for the road team led to a 2-1 road loss.

Zaragoza was on the bench for Celta Vigo‚Äôs 2-0 home win against Athletic Club Bilbao, but did not make it into the match.

Celta Vigo will play twice on the road this week: on Wedenday against second division side Albacete in the Copa del Rey and on Saturday in league play against Real Oviedo.

Lovro Zvonarek is the only player on loan from the first team to the Swiss Super League.

Zvonarek started for Grasshopper in their lone win this month so far on the road against Cham in the Swiss Cup. He did not directly contribute to a goal, but his team scored two quick goals in the first half. He was subbed off in the 62nd minute with his team up 2-0. Cham scored a late goal in stoppage time, but it was not enough. Grasshopper won 2-1 to advance to the next round.

Zvonarek started again for Grasshopper last weekend in a home league match against Servette. He had four shots ‚Äî three blocked and one missed wide ‚Äî and two chances created for his teammates to shoot. Zvonarek was on the field for the entire match, but could not help his teammates find a goal, and they fell 1-0 at home.

Grasshopper travelled to face Sion on Saturday. Zvonarek started again and played the full 90 minutes. He did not have a shot attempt and had two chances created. He also helped back on defense with an interception and seven recoveries. Grasshopper were shutout again in this match and fell 1-0 on the road.

Grasshopper will travel to face Young Boys on the road on Wednesday and then will host St. Gallen on Sunday for their last match of 2025.

There are two players from the first team on loan to the 2. Bundesliga: Maurice Krattenmacher and Tarek Buchman.

Hertha BSC faced Kaiserslautern at home in the DFB-Pokal on 12/2. Krattenmacher started on the bench and saw a three-goal first half for his team. Hertha scored one more goal before bringing him on in the 72nd minute, up 4-1. Just three minutes later, he recorded an assist on Hertha‚Äôs fifth goal. In the 80th minute Krattenmacher scored the sixth and final goal as Hertha cruised to a massive 6-1 home win.

Krattenmacher started on the bench for Hertha‚Äôs home league match against Magdeburg last weekend. He entered the match in the 65th minute with his team down 1-0. He had two shots ‚Äî both blocked ‚Äî and created one shot for his teammates to shoot. Unfortunately there were not able to find a goal and Magdeburg scored a late goal to end Hertha‚Äôs winning streak with a 2-0 shutout for the road team.

Hertha travelled to face Greuther F√ºrth on Friday. Krattenmacher entered the match in the 86th minute after a wild back and forth match led to a 3-3 score. He had one shot on goal and created a chance for his teammates to shoot, but it was not enough to find a winner. The match ended 3-3.

Hertha will finish off the year with a home match against Arminia Bielefeld on Friday.

Buchmann is no longer on the injury list, but has not made it back onto a matchday squad since. He missed the 2-2 draw at home against local rivals Greuther F√ºrth and the 1-0 road loss against Schalke 04.

N√ºrnberg will host Aseko‚Äôs Hannover 96 for their last match of the year.

There are seven players on loan from the second team.

There are two players on loan from the second team in the 2. Bundesliga: Noel Aseko and Paul Scholl.

Aseko started last weekend for Hannover 96 on the road to Preussen M√ºnster. He did not have a shot attempt nor did he create a shot attempt for his teammates. In fact, he had the least amount of touches for anyone that played the full 90 minutes. Hannover took a two-goal lead into the 90th minute but allowed two stoppage time goals ‚Äî including one from Bavarial Loan Works alum, Oliver Batista-Meier ‚Äî and had to settle for a 2-2 draw on the road.

Hannover hosted Bochum on Saturday. He again had a low number of touches, but this time only played 82 minutes. He again did not have a shot, nor did he create any chances. His best stat was his 100% completed passes, even if he only attempted 12 passes. The match ended scoreless.

Hannover will finish the year with a trip to nothern Bavaria to take on N√ºrnberg.

Scholl was on the bench for KSC‚Äôs 3-2 road loss to SV Darmstadt but did not make it onto the pitch.

Scholl was on the bench against as Karlsruhe hosted Paderborn on Saturday. He came into the match in the 82nd minute when KSC was down three goals and a man. One minute later a second Karlsruhe player was sent off. Scholl had just six touches in his short time on the pitch. Paderborn added a fourth goal and won 4-0.

KSC will be on the road against Bochum on Saturday.

Max Schmitt is the only player on loan in the 3. Liga.

Schmitt was the second keeper for Ulm‚Äôs 1-0 win away to Viktoria K√∂ln and a 5-3 home loss against VfL Osnabr√ºck.

Ulm will face RW Essen on the road on Saturday.

There are two players on loan in the Regionalliga S√ºdwest: Benedikt Wimmer and David Emmanuel.

Wimmer was not in the matchday squad for Sandhausen‚Äôs 3-2 win over Hessen Kassel in their final match of the year.

Emmanuel was on the bench for Kassel‚Äôs 3-2 home loss against Sandhausen but did not make it onto the pitch. This was Kassel‚Äôs final match of the year

Johnathan Asp Jensen is the only player from the second league on loan to the Swiss Super League.

Asp started for Grasshopper on the road against Cham in the Swiss Cup back on 12/2. He did not directly contribute to a goal, but his team scored two quick goals in the first half. Asp was subbed off in the 76th minute with his team up 2-0. The home team scored a late goal in second half stoppage time, but it was not enough. Grasshopper won 2-1 to advance to the next round.

Asp started last weekend in a home league match against Servette and played the full 90 minutes. He had one shot ‚Äî blocked before it got to the keeper ‚Äî and two chances for his teammates to shoot. Asp was not able to help his team find a goal and they fell 1-0 at home.

Asp started for Grasshopper again on the road against Sion. He had a busy day with seven shot attempts ‚Äî two on goal, four missed high or wide, and one that hit the crossbar ‚Äî and created one chance for his teammates to shoot. His seventh and final shot attempt came from the penalty spot. His shot was on goal but he was not able to get it past Sion‚Äôs keeper. This would have been a late equlizer but instead Grasshopper fell 1-0 on the road.

Grasshopper will travel to face Young Boys on the road on Wednesday and then will host St. Gallen on Sunday for their last match of 2025.

Maximilian Hennig is the only player on loan to the Austrian Bundesliga.

Hennig started last weekend for Hartberg at home against LASK. He assisted a goal in the 25th minute to make it 2-0. He also helped on defense with four clearances and a recovery. He was subbed off at halftime with his team up 2-1 and up a man after a late first half red card. He watched a crazy second half as the keeper, Bavarian Loan Works alum Tom H√ºlsmann received two yellows and was also sent off. LASK equalized in second half stoppage time and the match ended with a 2-2 draw.

Hennig was not on the matchday squad for Hartberg‚Äôs final match of year ‚Äî a 2-1 win against WSG Tirol.

Mudaser Sedat is the only person on loan to Austria‚Äôs second league.

Sedat was not in the matchday squad for Amstetten‚Äôs 3-3 road draw against Sturm Graz II. Incidentally, Amstetten‚Äôs keeper was also sent off in this match. He also missed Amstetten‚Äôs last match of the year, a 2-1 win against Admira Wacker.

There are two players on loan from the women‚Äôs team.

Edna Imade is the only player on loan to Spain‚Äôs Primera Divisi√≥n Femenina.

Imade was on the bench for Sociedad‚Äôs trip to face Real Madrid. She came into the match in the 58th minute with her team down 1-0. She only had four touches in the time she was on the pitch but created a chance for her teammates to shoot. Her efforts were not enough and Sociedad fell 1-0 on the road.

Imade started for Sociedad and played most of the match at home against Deportivo La Coruna. She had six shots ‚Äî one on goal, one blocked, two missed, and two that hit the woodwork. Luckily her teammates were able to score three goals, even if Imade could not put one of her attempts in.

Real Sociedad will travel to face Deportivo La Coruna again on Sunday, but this time in the Copa del Reina.

Ana Guzm√°n is the only player on loan to Brazil‚Äôs Brasileir√£o Feminino.

Guzm√°n started on the bench for Palmerias‚Äô second leg of the semifinals of the league playoff. She came into the match in the 78th minute with the match level at 1-1 and up 2-1 aggregate. She had one clearance and one recovery to help her team hold this result and move onto the finals.

Last weekend, in the first leg of the finals, Palmerias hosted Corinthians. Guzm√°n started on the bench and was subbed in in the 90th minute with her team up 4-1. She was not able to contribute anything to the match, but saw her team score one more goal to make it 5-1.

On Sunday, Palmerias travelled to face Corinthians in the second leg of the finals with that 5-1 aggregate lead in hand. Guzm√°n started and played 74 minutes. Palmerias allowed one goal, but still secured the trophy with a 5-2 aggregate win. This secures the league-cup double for Palmerias. With Guzm√°n‚Äôs loan due to end at the end of December, this was a great way to end her loan.

title: Minkah Fitzpatrick update adds insult to injury for Dolphins vs. Steelers
description: The matchup with his former team wasn't going well.
fullText:

Minkah Fitzpatrick had a chance against his former team on Monday night when the Miami Dolphins took on the Pittsburgh Steelers.

And that was before Fitzpatrick got hurt.

On a Steelers pass play in the second half, Fitzpatrick was nowhere near the ball.

But after the play, Fitzpatrick was on the ground, holding toward his lower right leg.

Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers came over to check on Fitzpatrick.

The Dolphins were down 21-3 at the time of the injury.

A whole bunch of Steelers came to check on Fitzpatrick.

Eventually, Fitzpatrick walked off the field under his own power with just a slight limp.

The Dolphins announced a calf injury for Fitzpatrick, who was questionable to return.

It seems like it could've been worse, but it clearly wasn't a fun thing to happen for Minkah against his former squad.

title: Tua Tagovailoa's contract looks like a nightmare for the Dolphins
description: This is only getting worse.
fullText:
Tua Tagovailoa's contract looks like a nightmare for the Dolphins originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Miami Dolphins are in trouble.

Tua Tagovailoa was supposed to be their franchise quarterback. Instead, his contract is beginning to look like an absolute albatross.

Can the Dolphins get out from under it? That's a question that'll be asked plenty going forward.

Needing a big win to keep realistic playoff dreams alive on Monday night, Tua spent the night throwing the ball to the other team.

The Pittsburgh Steelers played a bunch of zone, and it's like Tagovailoa couldn't see what was going on. A bunch of his throws were into clear danger.

If the Dolphins want to move on from this, it's going to be very pricey.

MORE:¬†ACL recovery timeline impacts when Patrick Mahomes, Micah Parsons will return

Tagovailoa signed a four-year, $212 million contract extension in the summer of 2024.

He's in the first of the four years of that actual extension, and he's earning $25 million in base salary for the 2025 season.

Tua is due to make $39 million in base salary in 2026, then $31 million in 2027 and $41.4 million in 2028.

MORE:¬†Bills may not win the AFC East ‚Äî but they sent a clear warning to the rest of the NFL

It'd cost the Dolphins $79.2 million in dead cap space to cut Tagovailoa right now,¬†wrote ESPN's Matt Miller on X.

There's an out in his contract before the 2027 season that would result in $34.8 million in dead money, which is really the first realistic time something like that could happen. But that's two years down the road.

Before then, the Dolphins would have to do something drastic.

It's getting closer to a move like that, otherwise the next couple seasons could be rough in Miami.

fullText:
ATLANTA, Ga.- The Creekside Seminoles entered the night as the highest-scoring offense in Georgia High School Association (GHSA) history. Though it took them a minute in Monday night‚Äôs Class 4A state championship against Benedictine Military School, the Seminoles eventually showed folks why they‚Äôre one of the country‚Äôs most explosive offenses.

Creekside trailed 24-21 going into halftime, but exploded for 21 third quarter points en route to a 42-39 victory over Benedictine Military School at Mercedes-Benz Stadium.

The Cadets held a brief 24-21 lead, but that would last for a little bit of the second quarter and halftime. After that, however, Creekside would take things up a notch or two, maybe even three.

Quarterback Cayden Benson and running back Ced Kelley both scored multiple touchdowns for the Seminoles as they began to break away from the Cadets in the second half. If the third quarter was the separation, the fourth was just putting the whip cream and cherry on top to their state championship win.

title: Report: Patrick Mahomes tore LCL, too
description: Patrick Mahomes underwent surgery on Monday night to repair a torn ACL in his left knee.
fullText:
Patrick Mahomes underwent surgery on Monday night to repair a torn ACL in his left knee. It wasn't the only ligament injured, after all.

Via Ian Rapoport of NFL Media, Mahomes also tore the LCL in his left knee.

Rapoport adds that, while it complicates the recovery, it doesn't necessarily extend the timeline for a return beyond nine months.

Still, it's more than a simple and clean ACL tear. Whatever the injury, the fact that Mahomes had surgery so quickly demonstrates his mindset. He will do whatever he can to get back as soon as he can.

Barring complications, there's no reason to think he won't be ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Yankees considering Michael King return as AL East rivals 'compete for' RHP in free agency: reports
description: The Yankees reportedly could reunite with Michael King as New York, the Baltimore Orioles and Boston Red Sox 'compete for' the free-agent pitcher.
fullText:
Are the Yankees considering a Michael King reunion?

The Boston Globe's Peter Abraham reported this week that New York, the Orioles and Red Sox "are competing for" the free-agent right-hander, whose "decision is not necessarily soon."

The New York Post's Greg Joyce added that the Yankees are "open to" reuniting with King, 30, whom they dealt among others to the Padres in their December 2023 trade with San Diego for outfielders Juan Soto and Trent Grisham.

"The thing about Kinger is he's got obviously great stuff and a great arsenal," New York manager Aaron Boone said last week at the 2025 MLB Winter Meetings in Orlando, Fla., according to Joyce. "He‚Äôs really smart and has a real good understanding of that stuff. It's allowed him to evolve as a pitcher, coupled with his confidence."

Starting 45 of 46 regular-season games for the Padres from 2024-25, King went 18-12 with a 3.10 ERA and 1.194 WHIP in 247 IP. He battled injuries during his second year in San Diego, limiting him to 73.1 IP over 15 starts.

"We are playing around with a lot of different ideas and seeing if it takes us anywhere," Yankees general manager Brian Cashman told YES Network last week.

King transitioned from reliever to starter at the end of his time in New York, a chapter that spanned five MLB seasons (2019-23). He made his MLB debut Sept. 27, 2019, with the Yankees, who landed him from the Miami Marlins in a November 2017 trade.

The Marlins originally selected King from Boston College with the No. 353 overall pick in the 12th round of the 2016 MLB Draft. The Rochester, N.Y., native played at Warwick (R.I.) Bishop Hendrickson High School before heading to Boston College from 2014-16.

title: Mike Tomlin, Steelers show concern for Minkah Fitzpatrick during injury
description: Former Steeler and current Miami Dolphins safety Minkah Fitzpatrick had a scary moment Monday night when he went down with an apparent calf injury early in the fourth quarter of the Pittsburgh-Miami game.  As Fitzpatrick stayed on the ground, the reaction from the Steelers‚Äô sideline said everything.  Head coach Mike Tomlin, along with nearly the entire Pittsburgh defense, came out onto the field to check on him.
fullText:
Former Steeler and current Miami Dolphins safety Minkah Fitzpatrick had a scary moment Monday night when he went down with an apparent calf injury early in the fourth quarter of the Pittsburgh-Miami game.

As Fitzpatrick stayed on the ground, the reaction from the Steelers‚Äô sideline said everything. Head coach Mike Tomlin, along with nearly the entire Pittsburgh defense, came out onto the field to check on him. It was a clear show of respect and care for a player who meant a lot to the organization and the people still wearing black and gold.

Miami later announced that Fitzpatrick was dealing with a calf injury and was questionable to return.

Fitzpatrick spent five seasons with the Steelers, from 2019 through 2023, after being traded to Pittsburgh early in the 2019 season. He quickly became a centerpiece of the defense and one of the most trusted players on the field.

During his time in Pittsburgh, Fitzpatrick was known for his big plays, leadership, and football smarts. He made multiple Pro Bowls, delivered countless momentum-changing interceptions, and helped lead a defense that was consistently among the league‚Äôs best. Just as important, he was extremely well-liked in the locker room and by the fan base.

That respect was still obvious Monday night. Even in a Dolphins uniform, Fitzpatrick was met with nothing but concern and support from his former coach and teammates. It was a reminder that some relationships in the NFL go beyond teams and jerseys.

For Steelers fans, it was also a reminder of how special Minkah Fitzpatrick‚Äôs time in Pittsburgh was‚Äîand why he‚Äôs still held in such high regard.

The game is developed by Redemption Road Games and published by tinyBuild. It was due to launch in October this year before being delayed indefinitely due to its "incredibly ambitious" setup. Kingmakers is among the top five most-wishlisted games on Steam.

title: Lost Sega Channel Games Saved In Latest VGHF Project
description:
Over 140 ROMs from Sega's long defunct Sega Channel, including service-exclusive games that were thought lost to time and never-before-published prototypes, have now been recovered thanks to the latest efforts of the Video Game History Foundation.
Sega Channel launched in 1994 and was one of the first subscription-based, digital game services, beaming new games and content directly to players' consoles through a television cable. The service shut down in 1998, and since then many of the exclusive games and content available on the service were thought to be gone forever.
